definition: abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards

sentences.english: The school is financed by American and South Korean evangelical Christians.
sentences.chinese: 學校的資金由美國和南朝鮮福音派教會提供。

sentences.english: Korea still keeps people locked up for refusing to perform military service.
sentences.chinese: 甚至南朝鮮把拒絕服兵役的人關起來。

sentences.english: The South Korean businessmen will take great risk for the slave labor.
sentences.chinese: 南朝鮮的商人是爲了這些奴隸勞工才冒這麼大的險。

sentences.english: These refugees had to be fed and housed in the South. A few thousand crossed over from South to North.
sentences.chinese: 於此同時也有幾千人從南朝鮮逃到北朝鮮。

sentences.english: The ROKs apparently have no stomach for fighting Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 南朝鮮人很顯然並沒有與中國人作戰的勇氣。

sentences.english: In the South, there is open talk of “liberating” the North.
sentences.chinese: 而南朝鮮的“解放北方”的叫囂，也是甚囂塵上。

sentences.english: It makes me sick too the way you gooks pronounce foreign languages.
sentences.chinese: 更讓我受不了的是你們這些南朝鮮佬外語的發音。

sentences.english: See you at the next Asian Games in Pusan, South Korea 2002.
sentences.chinese: 在釜山在下一個亞洲運動會看見你，南朝鮮2002。

sentences.english: Notable capital flow of migrants has taken place between South Korea and Yanbian Korean Autonomous Prefecture.
sentences.chinese: 顯著的移民資本流動已經在南朝鮮與延邊之間發生。

definition: fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
North and South Korea/bilateral Korean relations
the Mukden or Manchurian Railway Incident of 18th September 1931 used by the Japanese as a pretext to annex Manchuria/also known as Liutiaogou incident 柳條溝事變|柳条沟事变
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
